summary: The Security Council, recalling its previous resolutions and statements on the Central African Republic (CAR), adopted Resolution 2446 (2018) on 15 November 2018. The Council noted the Secretary-General's report of 15 October 2018, which followed the independent strategic review of the UN Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the CAR (MINUSCA). Determining the situation in the CAR remains a threat to international peace and security, the Council, acting under Chapter VII, decided to extend MINUSCA's mandate, as set out in resolution 2387 (2017), until 15 December 2018 and decided to remain actively seized of the matter.
